Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have you been since our last session?
I’ve been okay. I tried meditating a few times, but it’s still tough.
That’s understandable. Meditation can take time to get used to. How did it feel when you practiced?
I felt a bit restless at first, but I noticed some moments of calm towards the end.
That’s progress! It’s normal to feel restless initially. It sounds like you’re beginning to find some moments of peace. Have you been able to incorporate any grounding techniques?
Yes, I’ve tried focusing on my breath when I feel anxious, and it helps a little.
That’s fantastic! Breathing techniques can be very effective. Have you noticed any specific situations where you felt anxious lately?
Mostly when I’m alone or when I think about my mom.
It makes sense that those moments would trigger anxiety. Have you thought about how you might cope in those situations?
I’ve been trying to remind myself of the good memories with her, but it’s still hard.
That’s a healthy approach. Reflecting on positive memories can provide comfort. Would you like to share a memory that brings you joy?
I remember going to the beach with her. We would spend hours just talking and laughing.
That sounds lovely. It’s wonderful that you have those memories to cherish. How does thinking about that time make you feel now?
It makes me feel happy and sad at the same time.
That duality is completely normal. It’s okay to feel both joy and sadness when remembering someone you love. Have you thought about ways to keep those memories alive?
I thought about writing them down, maybe creating a scrapbook.
That’s a beautiful idea! It could be a therapeutic way to honor her memory and process your feelings. Would you like to set a goal to start that this week?
Yes, I think I’d like that.
Great! As you work on that, remember to be gentle with yourself. It’s a process. How has your exercise routine been?
It’s been good! I’ve been going for bike rides more regularly, which feels nice.
That’s wonderful! Physical activity can be such a great outlet. Have you noticed any changes in your mood since increasing your activity?
I think it helps. I feel a little more energized afterward.
That’s great to hear! It’s important to find activities that make you feel good. Are there any other activities you’d like to try?
I’ve been thinking about joining a local sports group or something.
That could be a fantastic way to meet new people and stay active. Would you like to explore that idea further?
Yeah, I’d like to look into it.
Perfect! Let’s make that another goal for the week. You’re making some great strides. How do you feel about everything we’ve discussed today?
I feel hopeful. It’s nice to have things to work towards.
That’s a wonderful feeling to have. Remember, it’s about taking small steps. I’m proud of the progress you’re making. Is there anything else on your mind today?
I guess I’m still worried about my depression. I just don’t want to feel this way forever.
It’s completely valid to have those worries. Remember that depression can ebb and flow, and with the right tools and support, it can improve. We can continue to work on coping strategies together.
That would help.
Let’s keep focusing on mindfulness and physical activity as tools to manage your feelings. Would you like to set another goal for the upcoming week?
Yes, I’d like to commit to practicing meditation daily and working on my scrapbook.
That sounds like a solid plan! I’m looking forward to hearing about your experiences next time. You’re doing great work, and I’m here to support you.
Thank you, Ellie. I appreciate it.
You’re very welcome! Take care, and I’ll see you next week.
